q3.question: Who is Matko?
q3.answer: ['a small-time Romani smuggler and profiteer', "Dadan's husband"]

q6.question: Why is Matko forced into a arranged wedding
q6.recall: Matko is forced into an arranged wedding because he owes a great deal of cash to Dadan, a gangster who double-crossed him during a smuggling job. Dadan offers to forgive the debt if Matko's son, Zare, marries Dadan's midget sister, Afrodita.
q6.vectordb: Matko is forced into an arranged wedding because he owes a great deal of cash to Dadan, who makes a deal that he would forgive the debt if Zare and Afrodita get married. Matko cannot afford to pay, so he is forced to agree to the deal. Zare is dismayed, since he wants to leave the place, and had hoped that the required mourning period for his beloved grandfather would give him the opportunity to get away, and thus avoid being married off against his will.
q6.hybrid: Matko is forced into an arranged wedding because he owes a great deal of cash to Dadan, a gangster who double-crossed him during a smuggling job. Dadan offers to forgive the debt if Matko's son, Zare, marries Dadan's midget sister, Afrodita.
